page.title: 13Petworth Visitors Recall War
page.content: During the War the Canadians were situated at Pheasant Copse in Petworth Park. They were not allowed to keep a diary or log book because if the Germans found it they would know what the Canadians were planning. They got back to Canada in 1944. We asked one of the Canadians what his most important medal was. He said that it was his Silver Jubilee. They said all that was different about Petworth was the new houses. From Canada to England it took them about six and a half hours. One of the Canadians said that Toronto is very like London, very crowded and everone very busy. They left Petworth to go back to London at 5.30 p.m. On the 1st May they go on to the VE pilgrimage in Holland.
